title: Who would you say are the kings of K-pop? Why? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, King of some category sometimes not subjective. Its a title given to unanimously the best of the best group/person in the category, someone that stands out from the rest. The king (father to be more precise) of Classical music is Johann Sebastian Bach, King of Pop is Michael Jackson and King of rock is Elvis Presley. The people mentioned based on every single aspect made them the King of their respective categories. So who is the King of K-pop? Well based on criteria of being near perfect and being on another level to the rest in terms of music only, it would be Big Bang. They separate themselves from the rest of K-pop acts in terms of musical style, album/record sales, concert tours you name it. Each member of Big Bang all have successful careers and they are the ones who fused western influences into K-pop shaping up the style of music K-pop is today. That’s a fact. Plus they have consistently done so at the top level for more than 10 years and counting something which Big Bang is the first and only group to have been able to do. Many acts tend to disband after around 7 years and even if they don't disband, they do not reach the same kind of success they once had, for example, Super Junior who reached major success with hits like ‘Sorry Sorry’ but never reached that success again thereafter. Moreover, Big Bang is the Idols of Idols. many of the current acts notably BTS have been influenced by Big Bang and have taken what Big Bang has laid out both domestically and internationally and developed it to another level, hence their major success in the U.S (I personally think BTS is very unique and in terms of influence have eclipsed Big Bang). However, if it wasn’t for Big Bang, K-pop artists and K-pop itself would not have developed into what it is today, which is why they are so respected by many K-pop acts. Hence, no matter how many groups are out there who have done well or are doing well, the structure of the current K-pop market has factually changed with Big Bang’s success and because of that they are the people current K-pop acts look up upon (just look at interviews about other groups talking about Big Bang). Therefore, from an objective standpoint, the Kings of K-pop are Big Bang.
